I think there is a longstanding bug in tor that sometimes causes it to get stalled during bootstrap with “No running bridges.” I have seen it with Snowflake too. One thing to try is deleting the state file in the datadir.

Some references:

  • obfs-flash-client does not reconnect well when browser proxy reconnects (#10242) · Issues · Legacy / Trac · GitLab
  • Fails to reconnect after connection loss when only one bridge is configured (#10993) · Issues · The Tor Project / Core / Tor · GitLab
  • Tor does not reconnect after network loss with guards used as bridges (#11301) · Issues · The Tor Project / Core / Tor · GitLab
  • meek browser stops working after many idle hours (#11562) · Issues · The Tor Project / Anti-censorship / Pluggable Transports / meek · GitLab
  • Problem running meek server without CDN, stuck at Performing bandwidth self-test...done (#26891) · Issues · The Tor Project / Anti-censorship / Pluggable Transports / meek · GitLab
  • https://gitlab.torproject.org/tpo/core/tor/-/issues/29245

  • https://gitlab.torproject.org/tpo/core/tor/-/issues/40396#note_2757812

link_counts.title: Hello, in China, currently, Tor Browser 8.5a11 version can't connect to Tor network through Snowflake bridge. (#30350) · Issues · The Tor Project / Anti-censorship / Pluggable Transports / Snowflake · GitLab

obfs-flash-client does not reconnect well when browser proxy reconnects (#10242) · Issues · Legacy / Trac · GitLab
